title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1262.80 - Mobile equipment, brakes and lights
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1262.80 - Mobile equipment, brakes and lights

State Regulations
(a) All mobile equipment shall be fitted with
a positive parking brake designed to prevent the equipment either from rolling
on sloping ground, or from becoming free rolling due to aircraft blast or
wind. (b) On every vehicle, trailer
or other piece of mobile equipment not required to be escorted by a following
vehicle or not required to be electrically lighted, a pattern of red #3272 and
silver #3270 alternate strips of pressure sensitive, wide angle, flattop

Scotchlite not less than one inch wide nor more than two inches wide shall be
installed. The pattern shall be in the shape of a "V", the stroke of the "V"
being not less than one foot wide and two feet long. The pattern shall extend
from the topmost corner of the rear of the vehicle to a point approximately 15
inches from the roadway. Any deviation from this pattern shall be subject to
the approval of the airport manager. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1262.80

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
